intro: Psychotria dunstervilleorum, commonly known as the Dunsterville's Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
